Class NetworkModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • NetworkModel

  • public class NetworkModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the network connection between server and client. Stores the socket and object streams and provides methods for sending and receiving Parcels.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.ObjectInputStream in 
      private boolean isServer 
      private java.io.ObjectOutputStream out 
      private java.net.Socket socket 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NetworkModel(boolean isServer) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeConnection()
      Closes the connection to the other peer.
      void connect(java.lang.String serverAddress, int port)
      Viewer (client): Attempts to connect to a server at a specified address and sets up input and output streams.
      java.net.Socket getSocket() 
      void listen(int port)
      Remote (server): Starts listening for client connection on a specified port and sets up input and output streams.
      Parcel receiveParcel()
      Waits for a Parcel to arrive over the socket and returns the Parcel.
      void sendParcel(java.lang.String feature, java.lang.Object payload)
      Sends a Parcel to the other peer.

        public void listen(int port)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Remote (server): Starts listening for client connection on a specified port and sets up input and output streams.
        Parameters:
        port - port to listen on
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - error while establishing connection

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String serverAddress,
                    int port)
        Viewer (client): Attempts to connect to a server at a specified address and sets up input and output streams.
        Parameters:
        serverAddress - server IP address to connect to
        port - port to connect on

      • sendParcel

        public void sendParcel(java.lang.String feature,
                       java.lang.Object payload)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a Parcel to the other peer.
        Parameters:
        feature - string representing a valid feature name, such as "terminal"
        payload - content to send
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - error while writing to the output stream

      • receiveParcel

        public Parcel receiveParcel()
        Waits for a Parcel to arrive over the socket and returns the Parcel.
        Returns:
        received Parcel

        Closes the connection to the other peer.
